medium_description_en: Prognoses prostate cancer based on microscopic tumor appearance.

seo.meta_description_en: The Gleason Score for Prostate Cancer provides prognosis based on microscopic tumor appearance.
seo.keywords_en: gleason score, gleason prostate, gleason cancer, gleason prostate score, gleason prostate cancer, gleason grade, gleason stage, gleason micro, gleason microscope, gleason tumor, gleason tumor score

how_to_use.use_case_en: Staging prostate cancer based on biopsy findings.
how_to_use.why_use_en: The Gleason Score is the standard staging criteria for prostate cancer.

next_steps.advice_en: Other scores like the UCSF-CAPRA Score or the D’Amico Risk Classification can help prognosticate using the Gleason Score and other clinical criteria.

about.formula_en: Addition of primary, secondary and tertiary scores.
about.more_info_en:
Grading System:

Gleason Score Prognostic Grade Group
Gleason score ≤ 6: I
Gleason score 3 + 4 = 7: II
Gleason score 4 + 3 = 7: III
Gleason score 8: IV
Gleason score 9-10: V

See below for the Gleason Score Diagram:

Validation.text: Pierorazio PM, Walsh PC, Partin AW, Epstein JI. Prognostic Gleason grade grouping: data based on the modified Gleason scoring system. BJU international. 2013;111(5):753-760. doi:10.1111/j.1464-410X.2012.11611.x.

Other References.text: Epstein JI, Allsbrook WC Jr, Amin MB, Egevad LL; ISUP Grading Committee. The 2005 International Society of Urological Pathology (ISUP) Consensus Conference on Gleason grading of prostatic carcinoma. Am J Surg Pathol 2005;29(9):1228-42.

creator_info.about_en: Donald F. Gleason, MD, PhD, (d. 2008) was former chief of pathology at the Minneapolis VA Medical Center. After completing his medical education, he spent time as a lieutenant in the Army Medical Corps. Though best known for creating the Gleason Score, he practiced urology and pathology many years, and for his accomplishments, he received both the American Urological Association's Presidential Citation Award and an Outstanding Achievement Award from the University of Minnesota.

input_schema.name: primary
input_schema.tips_en: The dominant pattern of the tumor (>50% of total pattern seen)

options.label: Closely resembles normal prostate. Glands are small, well-formed, closely packed.
Increased stroma with well-formed glands, but larger with more tissue between them.
Recognizable glands, but cells are darker. Some cells have left the glands and are beginning to invade the surrounding tissue or have an infiltrative pattern.
Few recognizable glands. Many cells invading the surrounding tissue in clumps.
Few or no recognizable glands. Often sheets of cells throughout the surrounding tissue.
